snippet: The victims were believed to be civilians in the attack near Camp Chapman in Khost Province, site of an bombing in 2009 that killed seven C.I.A. operatives.
abstract: Suicide car bomb attack kills 25 people and wounds 15 outside Camp Chapman, United States military base in southeastern Afghanistan; Taliban asserts responsibility for attack; same base was sight of suicide bombing in 2009 that killed seven Central Intelligence Agency operatives.

byline.original: By FAROOQ JAN MANGAL and MUJIB MASHAL
byline.contributor: Farooq Jan Mangal reported from Khost, and Mujib Mashal from Kabul, Afghanistan. Rick Gladstone contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The victims were believed to be civilians in the attack near Camp Chapman in Khost Province, site of an bombing in 2009 that killed seven C.I.A. operatives.

headline.main: 25 Killed in Suicide Bombing Outside U.S. Base in Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: 25 Killed in Suicide Bombing Outside U.S. Base in Afghanistan

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
